alert.note: Alert for Inland Jefferson; Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 9:28AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Jefferson, central Madison, southwestern Lowndes and southeastern Brooks Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 928 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles south of Quitman to near Madison. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Lake Park, Valdosta, Dasher, Greenville, Moseley Hall, Twin Lakes, Cherry Lake, Hamburg, Pinetta, I-75 At Exit 5, Lovett, Nankin, Empress, Clyattville, Hanson and I-75 At Exit 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
